description:
Jak and Daxter: The Precursor Legacy is a 2001 action platformer developed by Naughty Dog
for the PlayStation 2. The game follows the eponymous protagonists, a young boy named Jak
and his friend Daxter, who has been transformed into an ottsel. With the help of Samos
the Sage of Green Eco and his daughter Keira, the pair travel north in search of a cure for Daxter,
discovering artifacts created by an ancient race known as the Precursors along the way. When the
rogue sages Gol and Maia Acheron plan to flood the world with Dark Eco, they must stop their evil plan
and save the world.
game: Jak and Daxter The Precursor Legacy

alpha-v0.0.1.description:
Manual zip-up of the jakanddaxter world folder. Useful for those who wish to Alpha test the server and client -- and I greatly appreciate the testing support!

## What's Changed
* Jak and Daxter: Implement New Game by @massimilianodelliubaldini in https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/pull/1
* Jak and Daxter: Genericize Items, Update Scout Fly logic, Add Victory Condition. by @massimilianodelliubaldini in https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/pull/3
* Jak and daxter v3 by @massimilianodelliubaldini in https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/pull/4

## New Contributors
* @massimilianodelliubaldini made their first contribution in https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/pull/1

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/commits/alpha
alpha-v0.0.1.title: v0.0.1

alpha-v0.0.10.description:
## What's New
- Added two new Options: **Citizen Orb Trade Amount** and **Oracle Orb Trade Amount**. These allow you to configure the number of orbs required for the traders in the game. Keep in mind that you need to adhere to following equation: 
    - `2000 >= (9 * Citizen Orb Trade Amount) + (6 * Oracle Orb Trade Amount)`
- Removed "Bundle Of" from the names of orb bundles to be more readable.
- Added Location Name Groups.
- Set the default root directory to `%appdata%/OpenGOAL-Mods/archipelagoal` to avoid new player setup issues.
- Added better instructions to the setup guide.
- Added info on how the HUD works to the world guide.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/compare/alpha-v0.0.9...alpha-v0.0.10
alpha-v0.0.10.title: v0.0.10

alpha-v0.0.11.description:
## What's Changed

* **Support for the NEW mod system in the OpenGOAL Launcher!** 
    * Both new _**and existing**_ players should follow the updated setup guide to transition to the new system. This APWORLD update does _**not**_ come with a new mod update, so your experience playing an AP game should be the exact same as it was before.
    * This update will not prevent you from falling back to the old Mod Launcher if you need to for a currently running async game.
    * Keep in mind, the new Launcher may reset your in-game settings and save games, so you may need to set those back up again.
* **Fixed a bug in the Client where install paths with spaces would fail to launch the powershell windows for the game and the compiler.**
* **Introduced "Friendly Limits" to the player options.** 
    * Extreme values would lead to seed generation slowdowns and failures. These limits apply to both singleplayer and multiplayer seeds, though they have different limits. When you exceed these limits, a message is shown in `generate_early` to warn you as soon as possible. 
    * These can be overridden by a new host.yaml setting:

```yaml
  # Enforce friendly player options in both single and multiplayer seeds. Disabling this allows for
  # more disruptive and challenging options, but may impact seed generation. Use at your own risk!
  enforce_friendly_options: true
  ```    

* **Exempt's Code Review Updates** by @massimilianodelliubaldini in https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/pull/43
    * Optimized logic for recalculating reachable and tradable orbs.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/compare/alpha-v0.0.10...alpha-v0.0.11
alpha-v0.0.11.title: v0.0.11

## What's Changed
* Logging Update by @massimilianodelliubaldini in https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/pull/16
  * Fixes https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/issues/11, separates logs that a player should see from logs that only a developer would want to see.

alpha-v0.0.4.description:
## What's Changed
### Deathlink Added (https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/ArchipelaGOAL/pull/6)
Deathlink signals are sent when:
- Jak dies while on foot, on Flut Flut, or on the Zoomer.
- Jak catches a poison eel during the fishing minigame.
- Jak is eaten by the plant boss or lurker shark.

When Deathlink signals are received:
- If Jak is in a cutscene, the signal is swallowed and he will live.
- If Jak is in the fishing minigame, he will immediately fail the minigame.
- If Jak is on foot, on Flut Flut, or on the Zoomer, he will die in a random way.

### In-game Settings Added
Deathlink is toggleable at any time during gameplay through the Archipelago Options menu. This setting is saved to, and loaded from, a *.GC file in the ArchipelaGOAL mod folder. This may serve as the foundation for future optional features.

### Potential fix to incorrect Scout Fly counts added.

### Translations Added
- Swedish, by Level70
- Danish, by Jacobmix
- German, by Abbacchio
- French, by Troyoo

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/compare/alpha-v0.0.3...alpha-v0.0.4
alpha-v0.0.4.title: v0.0.4

alpha-v0.0.5.description:
## What's Changed
### Move Randomizer Added (https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/ArchipelaGOAL/pull/7)
  - Jak's moveset has been broken into 11 unique items and added to the item pool.
  - The orb caches in the game have been added as locations (excluding the caches in Citadel) (you need to collect all the orbs from the cache, not just open the cache, to complete the check).
  - All the regions in the game have been redone - going from about 20 to over 100 - to account for the different movement options you need to reach different areas.
  - The feature is optional and has an in-game override setting. 
  - Also included in the settings is a tracker showing you which moves you found. 
  - If the option is off, all moves are instead added to your starting inventory. The item pool is filled with green eco pills as filler in their place.
### Fixed Snowy Fort Gate and Citadel Sages (https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/issues/23).
  - The snowy fort gate used to open when pressing the fort gate switch button. Now, this no longer occurs. 
  - The gate used to not open when receiving the item while standing in front of it. You needed to reload the level by dying, leaving and returning, or reloading a save. Now, the gate opens by itself in real-time if you receive the item while standing in front of it.
  - All the same fixes have been applied to the final staircase and final elevator in Citadel with regard to the "Freed the Sage" items.
### Debug text has been removed from the game - it now _looks_ like you're playing the retail release of the game. 
  - You should no longer see `AS: UNKNOWN ID` and other odd text elements on screen. 
  - You should still be able to skip cutscenes by pressing Triangle.
### Documentation has been updated to list the moves being randomized, along with the orb caches that now act as location checks.

### Huge thanks to everyone who helped map out regions for Move Rando!
  - Lone
  - JacobMix

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/compare/alpha-v0.0.4...alpha-v0.0.5
alpha-v0.0.5.title: v0.0.5

alpha-v0.0.6.description:
## What's Changed
* Move rando fixes by @massimilianodelliubaldini in https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/pull/29


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/compare/alpha-v0.0.5...alpha-v0.0.6
alpha-v0.0.6.title: v0.0.6

alpha-v0.0.8.description:
## What's Changed
- Fixes https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/issues/35 by increasing the minimum height of the orb cache top when it opens, so Jak can walk under it.
- Fixes part of https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/issues/34, where the Raise The Chamber power cell needed more height than a single jump (may need to take the chamber back down to get it).
- Fixes https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/issues/33.
- Implements https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/issues/27.
- Implements https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/issues/22 by adding the following completion options:
  - Defeat the Dark Eco Plant
  - Defeat Klaww
  - Defeat Gol and Maia
  - Cross Fire Canyon
  - Cross Mountain Pass
  - Cross Lava Tube
  - Open the 100 Cell Door
- Added options to change the power cell requirements for Fire Canyon, Mountain Pass, and Lava Tube.
- Implements https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/issues/20, by changing the order of loading a save and connecting to AP. **You connect on the title screen, then load the correct save.**
- Implements https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/issues/19. You can see `Got {Item} From {Player}` in the normal HUD, and `Sent {Item} To {Player}` in the alternate HUD. Both HUD modes change to `Found {Item}` when you find your own item.
- Fixed an issue where dying in front of the final elevator will improperly cause it to spawn.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/compare/alpha-v0.07...alpha-v0.0.8
alpha-v0.0.8.title: v0.0.8

alpha-v0.0.9.description:
## What's Changed
- Rename completion_condition to jak_completion_condition by @DeamonHunter in https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/pull/41
- Fixes https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/issues/40 with a new flag to make sure orbs are subtracted only once - the client has be closed and restarted to reset the flag (meaning you should also be restarting the game).
- Fixes https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/issues/39 by refactoring the client to rely on async functions a lot more, allowing the client to process JSON messages and items without freezing the UI and timing out with the AP server.
- Refactors the orbsanity memory structure to keep track of the orb count for each level, rather than having only 1 variable that is constantly reset depending on the current level the player is in. This should protect against a situation where losing AP server connection while collecting orbs in a new level, would mean the server would never learn about the orbs you collected in the old level.

## New Contributors
* @DeamonHunter made their first contribution in https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/pull/41

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/compare/alpha-v0.0.8...alpha-v0.0.9
alpha-v0.0.9.title: v0.0.9

alpha-v0.07.description:
## What is this fixing or adding?
### Implements Orbsanity (https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/issues/9)
- Fixed some values that display in different HUD modes.
  - Regular HUD shows Received values, alternate modes show Per-Level or Global _Checked_ values.
- Added Update instructions to the setup doc.
- Fixed error spam in text client while offline, when dying with Deathlink enabled.
- Fixed ability to Roll into a Crouch stance.
  - If you don't have Crouch and you Roll, Jak is forced to stand.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/compare/alpha-v0.0.6...alpha-v0.07
alpha-v0.07.title: v0.0.7

beta-v0.1.0.description:
## What's Changed
* Maybe a little overdue, but **we're officially in Beta! That means I am calling this feature-complete** (at least for me).
* Any further updates will be focused on bugfixes, documentation, and performance optimizations.
* Deathlink Reset Stalls Fix by @massimilianodelliubaldini in https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/pull/47

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/compare/alpha-v0.0.11...beta-v0.1.0
beta-v0.1.0.title: v0.1.0

beta-v0.1.1.description:
## What's Changed
* Jak & Daxter Client : queue game text messages to get items faster during release by @t-rbernard in https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/pull/48
* Item Classifications (and REPL fixes) by @massimilianodelliubaldini in https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/pull/49
    * Seed Generation should now be faster as not all power cells and precursor orbs will be marked for progression. Based on your player options, the amount you need to reach the end of the game will be progression, and the remainder will be filler.
* A couple of bugfixes from the above two updates.

## New Contributors
* @t-rbernard made their first contribution in https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/pull/48

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/compare/beta-v0.1.0...beta-v0.1.1
beta-v0.1.1.title: v0.1.1

beta-v0.1.2.description:
## What's Changed

- **New Player Options!**
    - **Enable Ordered Cell Counts** sorts your randomly chosen cell counts into ascending order.
    - **Require Punch for Klaww** if you don't want to fight Klaww (and subsequently Gol and Maia) with just your goggles.
- **Option Groups!**
    - Orbsanity, Cell Counts, and Orb Counts add some much needed organization to the Player Options web page (if Jak and Daxter gets merged into the main site).
- Documentation updated to remove references to custom_worlds installation (if Jak and Daxter gets merged into the main site).

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/compare/beta-v0.1.1...beta-v0.1.2
beta-v0.1.2.title: v0.1.2

beta-v0.2.0.description:
## What's Changed
- Added version checking to the Archipelago memory structure. This will alert users if their current mod is incompatible with their current client.
- Added color logging to the client that alerts users to changes to the client and its agents (errors, warnings, info, etc).
- Launching the mod from the client now uses the proper mod-specific saves and settings folder.
- Refactor client agents to have more logging, more informative user messages, and rearranging how the agents call back to the client.
- Renamed the Scout Fly items to remove the level abbreviations. This was causing confusion even for the seasoned Jak speedrunners.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/compare/beta-v0.1.2...beta-v0.2.0
beta-v0.2.0.title: v0.2.0

beta-v0.3.0.description:
## What's Changed
- **Added a new messenger system** in https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/pull/54 that displays up to 3 item messages at a time.
    - This can be turned on/off in the Archipelago Options.
    - The message queue has a background limit of 10 messages to handle chain reactions and finished-game releases.
- **Removed the powershell requirements.** We now run the game and the compiler apps directly. 
    - The game will log its output to a file in `Archipelago/logs`. 
    - This removes an entire console window from the user's view, so it will be less cluttered, and it reduces our reliance on Windows.
- **Updated more error messages** to be more user-friendly.
- **Reduced possibility of getting stuck in orb vents.**
    - The vent top will now always hover over Jak's head, even as he jumps, even when he is on Flut Flut.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/compare/beta-v0.2.0...beta-v0.3.0
beta-v0.3.0.title: v0.3.0

beta-v0.4.0.description:
## What's Changed
- **#58 removes the requirement to copy `iso_data` from the vanilla game's location to the mod's location.** 
    - The mod's REPL should now be able to find `iso_data` by itself (with a little help from the AP client).
- **Fixed the mixed up names of scout flies (#57).**
- **Dying underneath an orb cache is fixed.** 
    - If you die (or load a save) while underneath an orb vent after collecting the last orb, you will still get the check. Just return to the orb cache's general area and the check will activate (the object needs to load in for it to happen).
- **Fixed Citadel Skip V2's elevator lock.**
- Bumped the memory version to 4.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/compare/beta-v0.3.0...beta-v0.4.0
beta-v0.4.0.title: v0.4.0

beta-v0.4.1.description:
## What's Changed
* **Automatically detect your OpenGOAL installation directory** when `auto_detect_root_directory` in your `host.yaml` is set to true (true by default). New users won't have to find their OpenGOAL install folder and edit their host.yaml with it, the client should handle all of that for them. If something goes wrong, the setting can be changed to false, and the existing `root_directory` setting will be used instead. All the same validation will still occur.
* **Deathlink setting is "remembered" when the user first connects to the AP server.** On connect the client will now read the in-game flag and send that to the server.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/compare/beta-v0.4.0...beta-v0.4.1
beta-v0.4.1.title: v0.4.1

beta-v0.5.0.description:
# What's Changed

- **This apworld update is accompanied by a mod update! Please update the mod before using this version!**

## Traps!
![source-1841320496](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1b247460-9b6b-49ae-bd4a-5b7dba4a3266)

- **Traps have been added to the game!**
- **New Options have been added for traps!** Please remember to regenerate your template YAML from the Launcher! 
- When creating your player YAML, you can choose which traps you want to generate with your seed, how many there will be, and how long they last. 
- There are a total of 14 unique trap effects! See the world guide for more information on how they work. (Or go in blind!)

## Item and Location Logical Changes
- **The 3 orb caches in Citadel are now Locations!** Don't forget to check them from now on!
- The last 2 orbs on Geyser Rock were moved to the cliff sub-region, so you are not forced to catch them with only blue eco and single jump.
- Sentinel Beach's two scout fly ridges were made accessible with any Uppercut and Jump Kick (using the vertical logs).
- A scout fly in Sentinel Beach was made accessible with open blue eco and single jump (from the Flut Flut egg).
- A scout fly in Spider Cave was made accessible with open blue eco and single jump (from the swinging pole course).
- Dark Cave's 5 precursor orbs are now properly locked behind the area's movement requirements.
- Snowy Mountain's movement rules have been optimized: most long gaps require Double Jump + Jump Kick, or Roll Jump.
- Lost Precursor City's Second Slide and Helix Chamber had a logic bug fixed.

## Client Changes
- The Precursor Orb icon will render properly in the Launcher, starting from AP 0.6.0 onward.
- Fixed non-ASCII characters in item names. If the game tries to say you sent "SIEGBRÄU" to another player, it would crash the REPL client. Thank you Dark Souls.
- Host.yaml errors have better descriptions.

## ArchipelaGOAL Mod Changes
- The mod had been updated to the latest version of Mod Base. The sound issues with overly loud victory animations on Flut Flut and the zoomer have been fixed.
- **The title screen of the game now has more info after you connect.** While it processes items from the Archipelago server it will say `Please Wait...`, and when it is done it will say `Ready!`, so you don't have to guess when it is ok to continue. If no items need to be processed, it will go straight to `Ready!`
- **Your player name and the first 8 digits of the seed number will be saved on each save file,** so it is easier to remember which file you were using when returning to a game. Whitespace and invalid characters have to be trimmed from your name for this to work, so choose names with care.
- **The item messages colors now match the colors of the Jak client:** blue for important items, green for filler items, and red for traps. Other players' items will always be blue (except for traps).

## World and Miscellaneous Changes
- Added per-region location groups (thank you @t-rbernard! [#64](https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/pull/64)).
- Option descriptions are more concise.
- Item generation was simplified, and generating filler items was made more robust.
- Option communication from the client to the game was made more robust.
- The `JakAndDaxterGame` log file is now date and time stamped, so it will not overwrite itself.
- A bug report page has been added to the Web World.
- Python 3.8 compatibility code was removed.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/compare/beta-v0.4.1...beta-v0.5.0
beta-v0.5.0.title: v0.5.0

beta-v0.5.1.description:
## What's Changed
- Fixed the Trap counts in the spoiler log.
- Fixed apostrophe's in item and player names in in-game messages.
- Updated various documentation, made it easier to navigate. 

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/compare/beta-v0.5.0...beta-v0.5.1
beta-v0.5.1.title: v0.5.1

beta-v0.5.2.description:
## What's Changed
* **Chosen Traps has been replaced with Trap Weights.** This will allow you customize the likelihood of each trap being generated in your seed.
* **Fixed title screen issue** where the game would never be told to update from "Please Wait" to "Ready" if you received new items while processing old ones.
* **Error message informs user about 'random-range' options.**
* **Error message informs user about the game booting too slow** and how to connect the memory reader in that scenario.

### Make sure you regenerate your template options! Because of the new Trap Weights option, 0.5.2 is not compatible with seeds generated on 0.5.1 and vice versa!

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/compare/beta-v0.5.1...beta-v0.5.2
beta-v0.5.2.title: v0.5.2

v1.1.0.description:
## What's Changed
* **Linux support added.** 

### WARNING

This apworld is mostly untested. Since I don't run Linux, I cannot make any promises on how well this will work, if at all. Your mileage will vary depending on your operating system, distro, and version. Downloading this apworld means you're accepting an extra level of effort for installation and setup, and I can only provide minimal support.

### Installation Instructions

1. You may need to install `PyMemoryEditor v1.5.24` as a prerequisite Python package. It is not included by Archipelago.

2. Backup your current `jakanddaxter.apworld` in `Archipelago/lib/worlds` to a safe place, preferably outside the Archipelago folder itself. You can move it, or you can copy it, **but it must also be removed from this folder.**

3. Copy the beta `jakanddaxter.apworld` into `Archipelago/custom_worlds`.

4. Test by generating a solo Jak and Daxter seed, hosting it on localhost, and running the Jak client. The client should be able to run the game and compiler automatically, and it should compile the game and set you up on the title screen for the game.

Please report issues [here](https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/issues), **do not report them on the main Archipelago repo.** 

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/compare/v1.0.0...v1.1.0
v1.1.0.title: v1.1.0

v1.1.1.description:
## What's Changed
* Putting PyMemoryEditor local. by @tioui in https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/pull/85

### WARNING

This apworld is mostly untested. Since I don't run Linux, I cannot make any promises on how well this will work, if at all. Your mileage will vary depending on your operating system, distro, and version. Downloading this apworld means you're accepting an extra level of effort for installation and setup, and I can only provide minimal support.

### Installation Instructions

1. Backup your current `jakanddaxter.apworld` in `Archipelago/lib/worlds` to a safe place, preferably outside the Archipelago folder itself. You can move it, or you can copy it, **but it must also be removed from this folder.**
2. Copy the beta `jakanddaxter.apworld` into `Archipelago/custom_worlds`.
3. Test by generating a solo Jak and Daxter seed, hosting it on localhost, and running the Jak client. The client should be able to run the game and compiler automatically, and it should compile the game and set you up on the title screen for the game.

Please report issues [here](https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/issues), **do not report them on the main Archipelago repo.** 

## New Contributors
* @tioui made their first contribution in https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/pull/85

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/compare/v1.1.0...v1.1.1

v1.1.2.description:

### WARNING

Since I don't run Linux, I cannot make any promises on how well this will work, if at all. Your mileage will vary depending on your operating system, distro, and version. Downloading this apworld means you're accepting an extra level of effort for installation and setup, and I can only provide minimal support.

### Installation Instructions

1. Backup your current `jakanddaxter.apworld` in `Archipelago/lib/worlds` to a safe place, preferably outside the Archipelago folder itself. You can move it, or you can copy it, **but it must also be removed from this folder.**
2. Copy the beta `jakanddaxter.apworld` into `Archipelago/custom_worlds`.
3. Test by generating a solo Jak and Daxter seed, hosting it on localhost, and running the Jak client. The client should be able to run the game and compiler automatically, and it should compile the game and set you up on the title screen for the game.

Please report issues [here](https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/issues), **do not report them on the main Archipelago repo.** 

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/compare/v1.1.1...v1.1.2
v1.1.2.title: v1.1.2

v1.1.3.description:
## What's Changed

* Removed a circular import, refactored the method that figures out how to run `goalc` based on operating system and available terminal applications. Thanks to Artamiss and Black Sliver!

### WARNING

Since I don't run Linux, I cannot make any promises on how well this will work, if at all. Your mileage will vary depending on your operating system, distro, and version. Downloading this apworld means you're accepting an extra level of effort for installation and setup, and I can only provide minimal support.

### Installation Instructions

1. Backup your current `jakanddaxter.apworld` in `Archipelago/lib/worlds` to a safe place, preferably outside the Archipelago folder itself. You can move it, or you can copy it, **but it must also be removed from this folder.**
2. Copy the beta `jakanddaxter.apworld` into `Archipelago/custom_worlds`.
3. Test by generating a solo Jak and Daxter seed, hosting it on localhost, and running the Jak client. The client should be able to run the game and compiler automatically, and it should compile the game and set you up on the title screen for the game.

Please report issues [here](https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/issues), **do not report them on the main Archipelago repo.** 

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/compare/v1.1.2...v1.1.3
v1.1.3.title: v1.1.3

v1.1.4.description:
## What's Changed

* Removed Pymem. We now solely rely on PyMemoryEditor for both Linux and Windows memory reading.
* Add konsole to list of supported terminal applications.
* Includes Archipelago manifest for future AP core support.

### WARNING

Since I don't run Linux, I cannot make any promises on how well this will work, if at all. Your mileage will vary depending on your operating system, distro, and version. Downloading this apworld means you're accepting an extra level of effort for installation and setup, and I can only provide minimal support.

### Installation Instructions

1. Backup your current `jakanddaxter.apworld` in `Archipelago/lib/worlds` to a safe place, preferably outside the Archipelago folder itself. You can move it, or you can copy it, **but it must also be removed from this folder.**
2. Copy the beta `jakanddaxter.apworld` into `Archipelago/custom_worlds`.
3. Test by generating a solo Jak and Daxter seed, hosting it on localhost, and running the Jak client. The client should be able to run the game and compiler automatically, and it should compile the game and set you up on the title screen for the game.

Please report issues [here](https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/issues), **do not report them on the main Archipelago repo.** 

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/ArchipelaGOAL/Archipelago/compare/v1.1.3...v1.1.4
